intro: Phyllanthus casticum f. fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered phyllanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India and Southeast Asia. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
